Class.name: EasyCSP.Converter.Converters.UDate
Class.Description:
Convert a Unix Epoch date to a visual

Options can be in any order and consist of the following flags:

  • D - Return only the date part
  • T - Return only the time part
  • I - Return the requested value part in internal format (NOTE: Dates are in the MV epoch, not Cache. Time is reckoned identially in both.)

    • if no options are specified, then an external date-and-time string is returned.

    if "I" is specified, then either "D" or "T" must be specified.

Method.name: run
Method.Implementation:
if $get(parameters)="" then return "Must pass parameters to " : @ME->%ClassName(1) UnixDate = parameters->get("value") OptionFlags = parameters->get("options")
if Abs( UnixDate ) = 0 then return ""
Time = rem( UnixDate, 86400 ) Days = int( ( UnixDate - Time ) / 86400 ) + 732 Results = ""
if OptionFlags = "" then return OCONV( Days, "D4/" ) : " " : OCONV( Time, "MTS" ) end
if ( index( OptionFlags, "D", 1 ) > 0 ) then if index( OptionFlags, "I", 1 ) > 0 then Results = Days end else Results = OCONV( Days, "D4/" ) end end
if ( index( OptionFlags, "T", 1 ) > 0 ) then if index( OptionFlags, "I", 1 ) > 0 then Results = if Results = "" then Time else Results : " " : Time end else Results = if Results = "" then OCONV( Time, "MTS" ) else Results : " " : OCONV( Time, "MTS" ) end end
return Results
